Detailed Description

template<class T>
class EquivalencePartition< T >

A class for representing a set of objects that are partitioned into equivalence classes, such that all members of a partition are equivalent

The class enforces transitivity, i.e. A=B & B=C implies A=C

Member Function Documentation

template<class T>
int EquivalencePartition< T >::equate ( const T &  x,
const T &  y 
) [inline]

Equates x and y. Both may or may not already exist in the partitioning. returns the id of the class that they are in.

template<class T>
int EquivalencePartition< T >::equivalenceClass ( const T &  x  )  const [inline]

returns the ID of the equivalence class that x belongs to, or -1 if x is not in this partitioning.

create a new equaivalence class and return its id.

const T &  x 
) [inline]

insert x into equivalence class i. Returns true if x is new.

template<class T>

int  j 
) [inline]

merges two equivqalence classes, returning the id of the merged class
